problems.title: Extended Euclidean Algorithm
problems.description:
Given two integers a and b, the extended Euclidean algorithm finds integers x and y such that ax + by = gcd(a, b).
You are given a and b. Your task is to compute one pair (x, y) along with gcd(a, b).

Input Format:
Two space-separated integers a and b.

Output Format:
Print three space-separated integers: g, x, y where g = gcd(a, b) and ax + by = g.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
30 20

Sample Output
10 1 -1

Explanation:
One possible solution is g = 10, x = 1, y = -1 because 30*1 + 20*(-1) = 10.
hintsList: Use the recursive relation: extendedGcd(a, b) = extendedGcd(b, a % b). Back-substitute to find x and y when unwinding the recursion.
